At that time, the bodhisattva Mahasudatta addressed the Buddha, saying: World-Honored One! World-Honored One! Bodhisattvas

World-Honored One!
Emptiness and all afflictions are the same, without distinction.
World-Honored One!

Bodhi, all afflictions, and all sentient beings - these dharmas are also the same, without distinction. It is only the ordinary beings who fall into inverted thoughts, discriminating between what defiles me and what purifies me.

Bodhisattvas should practice in accordance with the current against the stream, not in accordance with the current with the stream.
World-Honored One!
Bodhisattvas who attain liberation are in nirvana, not in the world.
Why is it so?
Bodhisattvas should fear nirvana and not fear the world, because by contemplating the world, they attain great compassion and realize great enlightenment.
